title: Week 48: Breakthroughs in Agentic AI, Models, Tools, and Memory Systems
summary: This week introduced powerful new agentic models, long-term memory papers, major API updates, and cutting-edge image generation systems. The ecosystem continues to accelerate around agents, retrieval, interactive UIs, and scientific AI.

sections.heading: OmniScientist: AI Scientists Framework
sections.content: A full scientific research framework enabling AI–human co-evolution through infrastructure modeling, literature review, ideation, and experiment design.

sections.heading: Claude Opus 4.5
sections.content: Anthropic’s newest flagship model featuring major improvements in agentic workflows, coding, reasoning, and long-context tasks.

sections.heading: Fara-7B: Efficient Computer Use Agent
sections.content: A 7B model capable of full computer-use via screenshots and coordinate actions, enabling local and lightweight agentic automation.

sections.heading: MiniMax-M2 Deep Research Agent
sections.content: A deep research pipeline powered by MiniMax-M2, retrieval tools, and orchestrated multi-agent workflows to generate research-grade outputs.

sections.heading: General Agentic Memory (GAM)
sections.content: A memory paper introducing a just-in-time compilation memory mechanism for long-term scalable agent memory.

sections.heading: Gemini 3 API Updates
sections.content: Google released refined Gemini 3 API updates enabling better thinking control, latency tuning, and improved multimodal reasoning behavior.

sections.heading: FLUX.2 Image Generation
sections.content: A 4MP, photorealistic, open-weights image generator with multi-reference composition and advanced editing capabilities.

sections.heading: Exa API 2.1 Search Tiers
sections.content: Major upgrades to Exa’s neural search stack across Fast, Auto, and Deep tiers, improving retrieval quality for agentic workflows.

sections.heading: MCP Apps for Interactive UIs
sections.content: A new Model Context Protocol extension enabling agents to serve interactive dashboards, forms, and visual UI components.

sections.heading: Event-Centric Memory for Agents
sections.content: A memory architecture using event-level semantic structures and heterogeneous graphs to improve long-term conversational recall.

sections.heading: Agent-as-a-Graph Retrieval
sections.content: A retrieval method representing agents and tools as nodes in a knowledge graph to improve multi-agent tool selection accuracy.
